definition: to be convinced (that sth is true)/to believe/to accept sth as true
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: However, Toni, who knows Ribery well, believes the Bianconeri should sign him.
sentences.chinese: 然而托尼很了解里贝里，并且相信尤文会签下他。

sentences.english: It is believed that the sperm whale dives deeper than any other cetacean.
sentences.chinese: 人们相信，抹香鲸比其他鲸类动物潜得更深。

sentences.english: I was so awful." Do you believe him?
sentences.chinese: 我真的非常糟糕，你相信他吗？

sentences.english: If you believe Sony it's still the best camera even without OIS.
sentences.chinese: 如果你相信索尼尽管没有光学防抖仍然是最好的相机。

sentences.english: We do this because we believe in the dignity and value of every person.
sentences.chinese: 我们这样做是因为我们相信每个人的尊严和价值。

sentences.english: I believe there is no way out of this forest.
sentences.chinese: 我相信没有戮由以从这森林走出去。

sentences.english: I send one to you eat, I believe you will like.
sentences.chinese: 我送一个给你吃口巴，相信你一定会喜欢的。

sentences.english: They believe themselves to be descendants of the Great Tree, a sacred tree in the forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们相信自己是森林里的一棵圣树“大树”的子孙。

sentences.english: Placebos work, doctors believed, because the mind is a powerful thing.
sentences.chinese: 医生们相信安慰剂起作用，是因为念力是一种力量。

sentences.english: Way back at the start of the semester when we asked,Why believe in souls?
sentences.chinese: 学期一开始的时候我们研究过为何要相信灵魂的存在？

sentences.english: Christians believe Jesus Christ was buried where the Church of the Holy Sepulchre now stands in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 基督徒们相信耶稣基督就是被葬在了这座圣墓教堂下。

sentences.english: As your sense of self-trust increases, so will your sense of self-confidence.
sentences.chinese: 当你不断地相信自己，你就会感到自信。

sentences.english: This is the day of salvation, calling sinners to repent and believe the gospel.
sentences.chinese: 这是拯救的时代，呼召罪人悔改，相信福音。

sentences.english: Metaphysic is the finding of bad reasons for what we believe on instinct.
sentences.chinese: 形而上学是我们为相信直觉而找到的坏理由。

sentences.english: The hawkish Cho believed the Separatists had attacked Glid Station.
sentences.chinese: 强硬的乔相信格利德站遭到了分裂分子的进攻。

sentences.english: Because he believed success came from industry, he was very industrious.
sentences.chinese: 因为他相信成功来自勤奋，他是非常勤奋的。

definition: to be certain/to be positive/assuredly/definitely/to give recognition/to affirm/affirmative (answer)
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
